content:
Neil Pilgrim (neiljp) said:

  • It seems that is used for 'agree' around here, so perhaps = would make an alternative for activating this feature?

Splitting this to a new topic, since it's a tangent from the original discussion, I think.

The emoji is a custom emoji in this realm, so not something we should build a feature around unless we want to add like to the "Zulip specific emoji" category (we'd certainly want a nicer glyph for that). It would be reasonable to have "I agree with this comment" emoji for an = keyboard shortcut. I think :100: is the standard emoji that's probably most similar in meaning? But at least to me, :100: has a kinda intense tone that I'm not sure is totally ideal for a "This is what I would have said" use case. (That could be just in my head!)

I see == is a custom emoji now, though my intention was not to make the emoji critical to the feature, and so necessary to include - I wasn't expecting the key to add that custom emoji, but rather enter(/leave?) the 'toggle existing emoji' mode discussed in the original topic, or just to toggle 'agreement' if there is one emoji present.

I agree that :100: is debatable as an 'agree', though I would consider it more like a extra-:+1:, or 'definitely' perhaps? - but then I'm not sure that emoji would translate to a single key in quite the same way, except perhaps %?. The mathematical grounding of = suggests it has a wider cultural application than potential other alternatives, maybe? It just seemed close to + :)
Isn't :thumbs_up: or :this: the general "I agree"?

:+1: is a touch ambiguous in that it's often any of: "I agree", "ack", "approved". I've also heard it now sometimes comes across with a passive aggressive tone. I certainly don't take it that way, but :man_shrugging:

: I often use :point_up: as a "THIS!" type of agreement.
Yeah, :thumbs_up: is more general. E.g., I might :thumbs_up: someone's checkin so that they know that I saw it and don't have any concerns.
Hmm, yeah, :this: is the one I've seen in other online communities; it might be the best of the options above in terms of not having other competing meanings.

FWIW I read :this: as having a quite emphatic tone. Like the capital letters and italics in Josh Klar's gloss for it:

Josh Klar said:

: I often use :point_up: as a "THIS!" type of agreement.

Emphatic, and a little confrontational â€” I read it as an emphatic "THIS!", which I associate with a meaning like:

"This is what I've been wanting/trying to say, and it's frustrating that y'all haven't gotten it yet!"
So to me it'd feel somewhat jarring to see it used routinely, in situations where people otherwise seem to be talking in a neutral tone without emotional excitement.
Yeah, I think :100: is probably a better existing emoji to use.

That said, I don't think that has the perfect connotation either; so we should perhaps go with :100: but have in mind the idea that if we can come up with an emoji for :agree: that's better, whether an existing one or something we design, we should probably feel free to replace it.
We could also just design the feature with = doing nothing if there's no existing emoji on a message, if we're not happy with :100:.
I generally see or :plus: when people agree to things, in most of the group chat places I hang out.
( is a custom emoji in this server; I don't think there's a similar unicode emoji.)
So we could add a custom +1 emoji for Zulip, or alternatively use :plus: which is unicode if I remember correctly, and is generally recognized as similar.
I think it will seem a little odd that = inserts a plus, and not +, which inserts something else?

I think what we're discovering is that there are a lot of different conventions which read differently to different people (e.g. :point_up: is the natural one for me).

So we may be better off having it do nothing if there are no reactions so far, or having it open the emoji picker.
Yeah I propose that we do nothing if there's no existing emoji so that we can achieve the main thing we're trying to do here -- we can always add behavior for the case with no existing emoji later.
